alert.note: Alert for Grays Harbor (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 14 at 3:05PM PST until January 14 at 10:59PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Chehalis River At Porter affecting Grays Harbor County. .With dry weather expected, the Chehalis River will recede to below flood stage tonight. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Chehalis River At Porter. * WHEN...Until late this evening. * IMPACTS...At 48.0 feet, the Chehalis River in Grays Harbor will flood low pasture lands and some roads. High tidal levels at Aberdeen will worsen flooding along the lower reaches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM PST Friday the stage was 48.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 PM PST Friday was 48.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall to 40.2 feet late Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 48.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this evening at 1015 PM PST.
